post.body: I dig Fringe as well. It's going to be a long December.
nah. Most people don't pronounce my name right.
I was supposed to make the cranberry sauce, but my wife beat me to it earlier today. just lemon zest, sugar, etc. no orange peel.
Because I don't like vanilla. Chocolate is my favorite.
I'll work on that on 2010. There's too much to work on for 2009 already.
amen. dropping oldest at school with 15° weather with a windchill factor of 7° makes me think about warmer places.
A CC-licensed Browser Security Handbook by Google: http://tinyurl.com/6qaao3 (RT--Awesome nightime reading!)
Tell your manager to fake a LOA so you can work. ;-)
imagine how much I code I have been writing w/o a single meeting, sametime, etc. In a nutshell, most of #Lookery's backend.
welcome to twitter
I was going to do the same (neighbor's generator) but mostly to run the heater. I see your priorities are different: i.e. internets
not necessarily, the context was more using message queues to distribute work, guarantee delivery, etc. not exactly email messaging.
tx. power is back at the torres' although I must say cold house did slow the kids down some. maybe I should reprogram my thermostat
I got the best Christmas card this week. Great job.
it's dangerous don't use it.
now my daughter wants one. $200 gone.
did the dogs drive on the way there? I wonder which is easier.
didn't know you were a runner. a snow one too. I have not made it to arboretum yet. will wait til summer.
stats regarding bank robberies: most money !recovered and race (white and black) tied for first place http://tinyurl.com/3p4oof
bacon? as in http://bacon.epcostello.net/
TPA->CUN in early January to celebrate anniversary. Can this twit serve as Lookery HR notice as well? ;-)
I'm in 26% down in 401K, Harvard is 22% on endowment, not bad. http://tinyurl.com/63jjlj
It's funny when people say I don't have an accent. Say hello to my little friend...
Reading Gitters vs Mercs http://tinyurl.com/659c8j I was a Merc, but I'm definitely w/Scott now. Of course, you might still be stuck on SVN.
53mins on hold with Massachusetts RMV. I want 'change'.
git-completion.bash gitnub gitx updated textmate bundle. I got the power.
getting old. football for 3 hours in freezing rain with mud and lots of fog morning after thanksgiving == really painful body for a few days
I love IKEA: they have turkey briners http://tinyurl.com/turkeybriners
I can't make up my mind between http://tinyurl.com/fastturkey http://tinyurl.com/highheatturkey http://tinyurl.com/brinedturkey
I'm getting hungry... visualizing my carving for tomorrow http://tinyurl.com/64hcxk
music, wine, cheese before brining the turkey. the kids are somewhere around here, but I can barely hear them. good.
it's been a very long day wrestling with hadoop and the kids. made an awesome sandwich, a little tv and I will surely crash. 'night tweeter.
Just busted the boys eating ice cream with bulldozers and diggers on the stairways.
Poor man's Hadoop Scheduler: hadoop job -kill $JOB_NAME
Planning for Thanksgiving. I'm not usually the planning type, but since I'm cooking, I better get it together i.e. turkey must thaw 1d/5lbs.
I could live with this for now: "specify a limit to the number of tasks per job permitted to run simultaneously" http://tinyurl.com/6nt8tk
A valid RDFa page! http://tinyurl.com/63d5vt Take that people that want validated XHTML with RDFa! http://nicecupoftea.org/
I'm very impressed with PHP today. curl_multi FTW!
http://twitpic.com/sn3s example house from last tweet
http://tinyurl.com/6jc4jj crazy street filled with christmas lights worth a drive
http://varnish.projects.linpro.no/wiki/ArchitectNotes made me deploy Varnish at #Lookery even though @mnot prefers Squid.
I'm glad I stopped honing UNIX skillz and printed Christmas cards envelopes instead.
Note2self: don't waste time typing 'netstat -an | grep LISTEN' just use 'netstat -pant'. I wish 'netstat -pants' worked easier to remember.
a friend said: "it's an axiomatic trait of a mature architecture to have some kind of messaging system involved" do you think it's true?
yes! on personal pulled pork flatbread coming up.
at flatbreads in bedford with wireless, brick oven and tons of kids. nice and warm.
just learned via twitter that I'm (us,ma) in a state of emergency (no power). discussing pilgrim times with wife over a cup of tea.
finally yay
backed out from roger's bbq (too southern) now sitting at redbone alley: one double rack coming up
temperature doubled twice since we left. the only issue now is either not enough yelpers here or lack of good places to eat.
http://tinyurl.com/8latdf the cheesiest display of Mexican culture.
arrived in richmond. crashing.
Here I am: http://tinyurl.com/72h24w cruising
http://tinyurl.com/8aujl8 syncing iPhone for more movies for the kids. 3g+pandora ftw
gmaps should add holiday routing: around malls
http://tinyurl.com/9z39ts pizza stop Calabria pizzeria
http://tinyurl.com/7xdta5 starbucks pitstop kids sleeping snow stopped southbury is cute
Just got back from CVS. It's fun driving in the snow but glad I stayed today. Leaving early tomorrow while it's not snowing.
midnight snacks from the neighbors http://twitpic.com/u3vr
For realz snow storm in the northeast tomorrow. FL drive postponed until further notice. One of the advantages of driving: Autonomy.
http://www.clintonfoundation.org/contributors/
http://tinyurl.com/6xey9h
For those Seattle twitterers, I'm grilling five rib-eye steaks outside in 27° weather with snow outside. Get over it now.
